etymologies: mid 19th century: from late Latin, neuter plural (used as a noun) of realis ‘relating to things’ (see real)

definitions: objects and material from everyday life, especially when used as teaching aids

examples.text: the industrial English language course makes extensive and varied use of realia, such as specifications, extracts from company brochures, manuals, diagrams, etc.

shortDefinitions: objects and material from everyday life

definitions: real things or actual facts, especially as distinct from theories about or reactions to them.
